in the neighborhood. 96, not a cloud in the sky or a breath of wind. It's HOT! I found a great recipe I want to try: Beef Stroganoff: Amount Measure Ingredient -- Preparation Method -------- ------------ -------------------------------- 1/4 cup flour 1 lb stew meat ½ stick butter 1 onion Mushrooms 2 cubes beef bullion 2 cups water 1 pint sour cream Garlic Salt Pepper Put steaks in a bag with garlic salt, pepper and flour, shake to fully cover meat. In a skillet place a ½ stick of butter and let it melt. Dump onion and mushrooms into skillet with meat and brown veggies and meat. Add the 2 cubes of bullion and water to skillet, and stir until mixture boils. Cover and simmer for half an hour, checking on it every once in awhile. After a half an hour add the 1 pint of sour cream a little bit at a time. Mix in thoroughly, and allow to reheat. Pour over rice. NOTES : Freeze this WITHOUT the rice/noodles - then the nite you want to make it make the rice/noodles FRESH! Doesn't that sound yummy! I'm still plugging away at Bringing Down the House. It's moving along pretty well and I'm still pretty interested...but my eye keeps wandering over to other books I'm dying to read. I hope I finish it! H~

I wish I was independently wealthy. I hate short weeks. It just makes the week feel longer to me. Work is soooo boring today because there is absolutely NOTHING to do! I'm reading a pretty interesting book right now. It's called Bringing Down the House: The Inside Story of Six M.I.T. Students Who Took Vegas for Millions by Ben Mezrich. I'm not very far into it yet, but it reads rather like a novel. I would say I'm probably hooked on it now. I tried 2 or 3 other books before this one stuck. I think I needed a bit of non-fiction after reading The Confessions of Max Tivoli by Andrew Sean Greer. Very sad, depressing book. Don't get me wrong though, I really enjoyed it. It was very...different.
